panoptes.camera package¶

Submodules¶

panoptes.camera.CanonDSLR module¶

class panoptes.camera.CanonDSLR.Camera(USB_port='usb:001, 017')[source]¶

Bases: panoptes.camera.camera.AbstractCamera

command(command)[source]¶
connect()[source]¶

For Canon DSLRs using gphoto2, this just means confirming that there is a camera on that port and that we can communicate with it.

get(property)[source]¶
get_device_version()[source]¶

Gets the Device Version string from the camera and populates the self.device_version property.

get_iso()[source]¶

Queries the camera for the ISO setting and populates the self.iso property with a string containing the ISO speed.

Also examines the output of the command to populate the self.iso_options property which is a dictionary associating the iso speed (as a string) with the numeric value used as input for the set_iso() method. The keys in this dictionary are the allowed values of the ISO for this camera.

get_model()[source]¶

Gets the Camera Model string from the camera and populates the self.model property.

get_serial_number()[source]¶

Gets the ‘EOS Serial Number’ property and populates the self.serial_number property

get_shutter_count()[source]¶

Gets the shutter count value and populates the self.shutter_count property.

is_exposing()[source]¶
list_config()[source]¶
logger = <panoptes.utils.logger.Logger object at 0x2adb9ec2ccc0>¶
set(property, value)[source]¶
set_iso(iso=200)[source]¶

Sets the ISO speed of the camera after checking that the input value (a string or in) is in the list of allowed values in the self.iso_options dictionary.

simple_capture_and_download(exptime)[source]¶
start_cooling()[source]¶

This does nothing for a Canon DSLR as it does not have cooling.

stop_cooling()[source]¶

This does nothing for a Canon DSLR as it does not have cooling.

panoptes.camera.CanonDSLR.list_connected_cameras(logger=None)[source]¶

start_cooling()[source]¶

Cooling for the simluated camera will simply be on a timer. The camera will reach cooled status after a set time period.

stop_cooling()[source]¶

Cooling for the simluated camera will simply be on a timer. The camera will reach cooled status after a set time period.
